Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2011 03:50AM agada wrote: I have heard of this theory before as well.  Working in a lab I also know that certain chemicals that you work with WILL give you cancer if you use them incorrectly.  We had a woman use one of these reagents that will give thyroid cancer if touched.  She accidently got some on her and now has thyroid cancer.  I have worked directly with some reagents that will also give you cancer if you touch them as well. Tha virus giving cancer is very interesting.  Perhaps an  accident happened somewhere and released a virus? I don't know.
Posts.Title: "Catching Cancer" Chickenpants Chickenpants

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2010 02:42AM agada wrote: Hello, It does not hurt to have the lymph node checked out.  You are not being paranoid and it does not mean you have cancer. The docs found my cancer by mistake when I was taken to the ER with chest pains. They did a CT scan and found small enlarged lymph nodes and suggested a follow up on them, which I did. That was when they found the DCIS.  I am not saying you have cancer, but if you have an infected lymph node you might as well take care of it and a sore breast can be refered pain.  Its worth treating just to get rid of the pain. Agada
Posts.Title: swollen lymph node lexiJ dirikuwanita

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2011 05:31AM agada wrote: I know what you mean. My doctor said I am cured BUT there is a 1% to 2% chance of my cancer coming back.  I talked to a pathologist here at work and he said they never believe a patient to be totally cured!  The percent chance of the cancer coming back should tell you something.  This does not mean it will come back, but the doctors err on the side of caution.  There are no guarantees in this disease.  Sucks, no?

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 05:16AM agada wrote: Don't lose faith in God or yourself.  You are stronger than you think, you can see this just by the fact that you have the courage to see someone who can talk to you about the cancer and your mom.  I think at your age (or other ages for that matter) that it is normal to drop out of school or have other problems.  Crying for some people is very normal.  Did the counselor tell you to go to a psychologist to see if you have  depression?  Maybe she can perscribe something temporarily to help you out at this time. Hugs. Agada

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2010 05:29AM agada wrote: FISH can be negative if you have an IHC of 3+.  We do see this from time to time.  You could ask for a recut and FISH restain of your blocks.  Tell your doctor that you would feel better if this testing was repeated.

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2011 12:10PM agada wrote: After doing enough DNA work to sink a  ship we find that an oral rinse, although less invasive, can come back inconclusive.  I myself prefer to work with blood.  It is not convenient for the patient (but the stick only lasts for a few seconds), but is usually better to work with in the long run.  Don't worry.  If you need the blood test, just go for it. Also, sometimes things come back inconclusive due to interfering substances and not gettting enough cells to work with. This can also extend the time it takes for you to get your results back.....or the lab has a back log of specimens. Agada
